intro: Tabernaemontana micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties. Tabernaemontana micrantha thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil.
